<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_n56g8qviCA1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><strong>Felipe (HarvesteR)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Business and design meetings are very much still <em>KSP</em>-related work, but they make for really poor dev blog entriesÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ I did manage to get a few usability tweaks implemented last week, and this week IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m now fully focusing on getting the Contracts system working. This turned out to be one gigantic system, which obviously means it took much longer than expected, but it also means that we have a very powerful, expandable, mod-friendly system that we can use to generate all sorts of interesting contracts. With such a large system, we arenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t shooting to have it fully completed in this update, but rather to have the underlying framework for it working to its best capability, so we (and the modders) can get creative with it later on and make the most of it. In terms of code complexity, the Contracts Framework is likely the new most complex single feature weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve got. There is still quite a ways to go with it though, but on the 0.24 release it should be at least a good showcase of its potential already.</span></p>

<p><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA): </strong><span>An instance of the new version of vBulletin 5.1.0 is been fully tested, so we can be totally sure the <em>KSP</em> Forums upgrade will work perfectly. I set the website page and image announcement in SpacePort Site for our move to Curse. Right now, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m doing research and reading some documentation about something Bob, Lalo and I will be setting (canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t talk too much about it, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll have news later). </span></p>

<p><strong>Mike (Mu):</strong><span> WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re entering experimentals for 0.24 after spending the past few weeks testing and refining the back end design for contract systems. Also been experimenting with some new shaders for the planets. These however will not make the cut for 0.24.</span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> last week I spend a couple of days at CreativaFest, and got to see some conferences by some extremely talented guys. All about animation, or animation production, I think we were some of the few video game centered speeches. Also, it was fun to see only 4 dudes in the room had already played (or knew about) <em>KSP</em>. *I guess there are not a lot of players around Mexico City. On the other hand, I finished a first draft of the new animatic, and started joint weighting on the new model that Roger did last week.</span></p>

<p><strong>Jim (Romfarer)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m in the middle of adding my own mods to the new gui systems IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve created. This has made me consider re-writing some of the code to make it easier to use, or rather it gave me a wider perspective on it, and there will be some modifications made during the experimentals phase.</span></p>

<p><strong>Miguel (Maxmaps): </strong><span>Engaging different sectors of the community on the move to Curse.com, knew the road would be rocky but I truly believe this will be a net positive and am willing to keep at it.</span></p>

<p><strong>Bob (Calisker): </strong><span>Spending some time with the community moderators and talking about our move to Curse.com for our official modding community website. We think this is going to be a great improvement from SpacePort and hope everybody gives it a try and shares feedback after using it so we can work with Curse to make sure our modders and players are getting what they need from this new resource. </span></p>

<p><span><strong>Ted (Ted):</strong> </span><span>Finishing up the QA on Contracts, with Experimentals being so close I can smell them. Though that may be an overheating GPUÃ¢â‚¬Â¦<br/></span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> <a href="http://i.imgur.com/UEM0eyk.jpg"><strong>This</strong></a>.<br/></span></p>

<p><span><strong>Eduardo (Lalo):</strong>*Following up some administrative arrangements</span><span> </span></p>

<p><span><strong>Rogelio (Roger):</strong> Last week Daniel and me went to creativa fest, an animation and videogames festival in mexico city where we saw disney, dreamworks and nickelodeon animation directors and producers. This week IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve just finished the new model for cinematics, and today I started to model an environment for the next cinematic. </span></p>
Expeeeeeerimentals! Wohoo!
What are experimentals?

Like, the final testing stage of development. In other words, release is soon!

Experimentals are what all the testers get to play with, it's pretty close to the full game.

Also Rowd, I know what you feel in that curse thread
Release is soon!

Release is soon!

"-ish". Testing can take weeks, depending on how many problems can crop up!
I'm not sure I understand Anthony's picture.

Hes putting out fires. As in all the 'flames' from the Curse site hosting mods. Personally I never heard of it before today, I like Nexus. But I dont really mod Kerbal anyways so its not a big deal for me either way. I can wait till after 1.0 when they might look to steam workshop.
Can't wait for 0.24!

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> <a href="http://i.imgur.com/UEM0eyk.jpg"><strong>This</strong></a>.<br/></span></p>

I feel you, man.

Very interested to see how things work with Curse. I've heard good things, so I'm hopeful.

Also someone will probably come in here with hard numbers, but IIRC in the past we've generally gone 1 to 2 weeks between the start of Experimentals and the release of the update to the wild. Considering Experimentals are "so close [Ted] can smell them" I'd say we're 3-4 weeks from 0.24.

Note that I am in no way affiliated with Squad and have no proven prognostication powers. I can barely even say "proven prognostication powers" out loud 3 times fast, though I was oddly able to type it without error twice in a row.

I hope that Squad won't repeat its mistakes with 0.23.5 update. That being:

1) Do not, I repeat, DO NOT build hype early.

2) Do not rush it, and encourage your testers to try as many situations as possible. Yes, I'm talking about 0.23.5 career save bug. To quote from ARM Release Notes: "This issue managed to slip by undetected through testing, most likely because it requires an old save to be reproduced".

I'm not sure I understand Anthony's picture.

He's fighting flamers.
Experimentals!

I hope that Squad won't repeat its mistakes with 0.23.5 update. That being:

1) Do not, I repeat, DO NOT build hype early.

2) Do not rush it, and encourage your testers to try as many situations as possible. Yes, I'm talking about 0.23.5 career save bug. To quote from ARM Release Notes: "This issue managed to slip by undetected through testing, most likely because it requires an old save to be reproduced".

So much this..
I wouldn't say they're being at risk of building hype too early for 0.24 if the details of the contract system development have been fairly hush-hush and it's in experimentals now.

He's fighting flamers.

No, he is firefighting.

The Curse thread is long, but remarkably civilized (at least the parts I skimmed).

And that picture cracked me up
Felipe&Co. - just one question guys: Will there be new biomes? I don't ask where and how many Just yes or no will be sufficient answer. Pleasseeee?

Felipe&Co. - just one question guys: Will there be new biomes? I don't ask where and how many Just yes or no will be sufficient answer. Pleasseeee?

Yeah, it's about time to give some flavor for Duna and Ike (probably most popular destinations after Kerbin SOI).

BTW, I think it would be a good idea to make some kind of a poll so that community could express what we would like to see in the next few updates the most. I'm talking about things like more biomes or planets, not something "new" requiring a lot of work with the code bur rather something filling gaps. Just throwing this idea here, maybe Rows will notice this

2) Do not rush it, and encourage your testers to try as many situations as possible. Yes, I'm talking about 0.23.5 career save bug. To quote from ARM Release Notes: "This issue managed to slip by undetected through testing, most likely because it requires an old save to be reproduced".

Testers are in fact encouraged to try anything possible to break the game. That's the very nature of testing. But you can't possibly think of ALL possible situations. There will always be bugs - you just have to accept that as fact.

Perhaps you should apply to being a tester as well?

BTW, I think it would be a good idea to make some kind of a poll so that community could express what we would like to see in the next few updates the most. I'm talking about things like more biomes or planets, not something "new" requiring a lot of work with the code bur rather something filling gaps. Just throwing this idea here, maybe Rows will notice this

I've been wanting a "popular request" update for some time. Certainly recent updates have been excellent about expanding the game outwards, but now I feel is the time to build upwards. Perhaps add deadly reentry and/or unbjork the aerodynamic model of the game. Just a suggestion!

Really happy to see you guys are still going strong and not letting yourselves get beat down by the vocal minority that seems to have infected practically every user generated place on the net.

Very nice to see so much work has been done and is being done, and I'm very glad you're not rushing things even more than you might already be doing.

As someone who regularly introduces kerbal to the uninitiated(all very well educated I might add), I can definitely appreciate the amount of time being spent on streamlining the interface and gameplay, especially for something as big and complicated as a contract system. For us veterans small discrepancies and minor bugs might not be as big of a deal, because we understand how most of the stuff works and also know what is not supposed to work or happen. For new players though, small stuff can really make or break those first 30 minutes and therefore might scare them away of this (otherwise) very good game.

I've been holding out on starting a new career since 0.23.5 came out and really looking forward to trying it all out with the new version.

Keep it up!
Whoooohoo! Experimentals!!

WHAT?! EXPERIMENTALs! I just finished getting all my mods back and working nicely together:(

ooo well contracts! here we come.
Experimentals! Woohoo!
